@elisee_fur We're sentimental about water too! But please bear in mind - this is for less trained people, afraid of getting #COVID19, using the taps in public spaces. How do they then open the taps again? What should they do with the "turn-around" taps? We need here one-fits-all approach.

@jsantanalopes @WHO 2/2
if sb's in a good position of having an automatic tap, then there's much less water waste. You can also elbow the tap off but then: 1) you need to find a way to open it again without contamination of the hands 2) you need to think about people who use the turn-around taps.

urls.title: First cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in the WHO European Region, 24 January to 21 February 2020
urls.description: In the WHO European Region, COVID-19 surveillance was implemented 27 January 2020. We detail the first European cases. As at 21 February, nine European countries reported 47 cases. Among 38 cases studied, 21 were linked to two clusters in Germany and France, 14 were infected in China. Median case age was 42 years; 25 were male. Late detection of the clusters’ index cases delayed isolation of further local cases. As at 5 March, there were 4,250 cases.
